title.narrative: Asian market entry for Betolar geopolymer technology

description.narrative: Betolar?s patented technology turns different waste materials from burning fossil fuels and processing pulp and minerals into solid geopolymer-based construction materials. These materials can be used to replace products made from concrete and natural ston e. Based on the principles of circular economy we process waste streams from one industry and turn them into valuable raw material for the construction industry. Betolar?s technology enables us to significantly reduce the production of Portland cement that is a major carbondioxide emittor and thus contribute to building a low carbon society. We are currently building supply chains in Finland with a few industrial partners and based on our learnings we will create license based partnerships in our targeted m arkets abroad. Along Finland?s reference market we are expanding our business to Asia Africa and South-America. With the funding we are choosing partners from three Asian markets. The funded project consists of a market analysis which enables us to estimat e the different industrial side streams and find potential application areas and partners. After we have selected our parter(s) we build a business plan define our operational model and conduct the necessary pilots in order to verify the raw material prope rties and product functionalities.The funded project brings significant benefits to our target countries. The main benefit is the advancement towards carbon neutral building and achiving UN?s Sustainable Development Goals. Betolar further provides a soluti on for the global industrial waste problems and saves unused raw materials - both within cement and natural stone production. Additionally the products made from waste streams can be priced lower than the current concrete products which contributes to solv ing the challenge of the housing shortage for example in India. The goal is to expand Betolar?s licensed technology to the targeted markets using the current distibution channels of raw material suppliers and/or machine producers. This allows the current a nd newcoming businesses an opportunity to take their business towards environmental social and economical sustainability.
